alert.note: Alert for Bear River Range; Caribou Range (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued October 20 at 1:59PM MDT until October 23 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON ABOVE 7000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow, heavy at times above 7000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches below 7000 feet and 8 to 14 inches in the mountains above 7000 feet. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Caribou and Bear River Ranges, including Emigration Summit. * WHEN...From Saturday afternoon through Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult, especially over mountain passes with areas of blowing and drifting snow. * ADDITIONAL IMPACTS...Backcountry enthusiasts and hunters should be prepared for wintry conditions and the potential for hypothermia if caught in a storm unprepared.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
